title: Harissa-Spiced Lamb Burger
subtitle: with Roasted Carrot Fries
time: Give ketchup the night off. Harissa is a Tunisian ingredient made from a combination of sweet red peppers, chilies, garlic and spices. Though a little on the spicy side, harissa is the perfect condiment for these burgers. Its complex flavors meld into a subtle background that lets the stars of this dish shine. Just a dab of harissa will accent the bright, peppery mint, juicy lamb and rich, crumbled feta of this tasty burger.
desc: Give ketchup the night off. Harissa is a Tunisian ingredient made from a combination of sweet red peppers, chilies, garlic and spices. Though a little on the spicy side, harissa is the perfect condiment for these burgers. Its complex flavors meld into a subtle background that lets the stars of this dish shine. Just a dab of harissa will accent the bright, peppery mint, juicy lamb and rich, crumbled feta of this tasty burger.
ingredients: 2  Teaspoons Mediterranean Spice Blend (Ground Cumin & Caraway Seeds)

steps.title: Prepare the ingredients:
steps.desc: Preheat the oven to 475°F. Wash and dry the fresh produce. In a small pot, heat 1½ cups of water to boiling on high. Peel the garlic cloves; smash 2 of them and mince the remaining clove. Split the buns. Pick the mint off the stems; discard the stems and roughly chop the leaves. Thinly slice the cucumber and place in a heat-safe container with the smashed garlic cloves and vinegar. Peel and cut the carrots into ½-inch thick sticks. Peel and cut the red onion in half; thinly slice one half into rings; mince the remaining half.

steps.title: Make the carrot fries:
steps.desc: Place the carrots on a sheet pan. Season with salt, pepper and the spice blend. Drizzle with olive oil and toss to thoroughly coat. Roast, stirring halfway through, 18 to 20 minutes, or until tender and browned. Remove from the oven and set aside as you finish cooking.

steps.title: Make the pickles:
steps.desc: While the carrots roast, pour the 1½ cups boiling water over the cucumbers and garlic in vinegar, making sure the cucumbers are completely submerged. Let stand at room temperature as you continue cooking.

steps.title: Make the burgers:
steps.desc: While the carrots continue to roast, in a large bowl, combine the ground meat, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, mint and as much minced onion as you’d like (you may have extra onion); season with salt and pepper. Gently mix to incorporate. Using your hands, form into 2 patties. In a large pan (nonstick, if you have one), heat 2 teaspoons of olive oil on medium until hot. Add the patties and cook, occasionally pressing the burgers down with a spatula, 4 to 6 minutes per side, or until cooked to your desired degree of doneness. Transfer the cooked burgers to a plate and set aside in a warm place as you continue cooking. Wipe out the pan.

steps.title: Toast the buns:
steps.desc: In the same pan used to cook the burgers, heat 2 teaspoons of olive oil on medium until hot. Add the buns, cut side down first, and toast 1 to 2 minutes per side, or until lightly browned. Transfer the toasted buns to a clean work surface.

steps.title: Assemble & plate your dish:
steps.desc: To assemble the burgers, spread a thin layer of the harissa paste onto the insides of each toasted bun. Place as much of the red onion rings and pickles (draining before using) as you'd like onto the bottom halves of the buns then top with a burger patty, the feta cheese and arugula. Serve with the carrot fries on the side. Enjoy!
